item.title: S. 2403, Grand Teton National Park Extension Act of 2006
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on May 24, 2006

item.title: S. 2403, Grand Teton National Park Extension Act of 2006
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on May 24, 2006

summary.text:
Grand Teton National Park Extension Act of 2006 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to: (1 ) accept from any willing seller the donation of any land or interest in land of the GT Park Subdivision; and (2) upon acquisition of land or an interest, include the land or interest in the boundaries of Grand Teton National Park and administer the land or interest as part of the Park.

Prohibits the Secretary from donating, selling, exchanging, or otherwise transferring any land acquired under this Act without express authorization from Congress.

Grand Teton National Park Extension Act of 2006 - Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to: (1 ) accept from any willing seller the donation of any land or interest in land of the GT Park Subdivision; and (2) upon acquisition of land or an interest, include the land or interest in the boundaries of Grand Teton National Park and administer the land or interest as part of the Park.

States that it is the intent of Congress that the acquisition of land or an interest in land be completed not later than one year after the enactment of this Act.

Prohibits the Secretary from donating, selling, exchanging, or otherwise transferring any land acquired under this Act without express authorization from Congress.

Authorizes appropriations.

(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the Senate on July 31, 2006. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Grand Teton National Park Extension Act of 2006 - Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to: (1 ) accept from any willing seller the donation of any land or interest in land of the GT Park Subdivision; and (2) upon acquisition of land or an interest, include the land or interest in the boundaries of Grand Teton National Park and administer the land or interest as part of the Park.

States that it is the intent of Congress that the acquisition of land or an interest in land be completed not later than one year after the enactment of this Act.

Prohibits the Secretary from donating, selling, exchanging, or otherwise transferring any land acquired under this Act without express authorization from Congress.

Authorizes appropriations.

item.title: Grand Teton National Park Extension Act of 2006
A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to include in the boundaries of the Grand Teton National Park land and interests in land of the GT Park Subdivision, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
